title: Chester Bennington: Linkin Park Always Had A Pop Element [News]
text:
Posted 4 hours ago 3 
Discussing the heavily-debated pop approach Linkin Park took on their upcoming album "One More Light," Chester Bennington pointed out the pop element was always there. 
Focusing on the new single " Heavy ," the singer said on The Elvis Duran Show : "What I love the most about being in Linkin Park is that it's like being in a new band every time we make a new record. 
"I think the only reason why [second LP album, 2003's] ' Meteora ' is so similar to [debut LP album, 2000's] ' Hybrid Theory ' is because we felt kinda pressured - and not in a bad way. The success of 'Hybrid Theory' was so big and so quick and so unexpected, it was like, 'I think we should do that again.' It was almost a very naive perspective of what we could do creatively. 
"But we knew, if you just listen to those first two records, there's hints of pop - there's ' Breaking the Habit ,' there's ' Somewhere I Belong ,' there's ' Pushing Me Away ,' ' In the End ' - all these songs are pop songs, we've had that element to the band." 
During a previous interview with Q104.3, Chester said: "What's wrong with [writing a pop song]?! With us, it doesn't seem to matter what kind of song we write, whether it's a pop song or a mid-tempo alternative song or a hip-hop track or a screamer. We get the same polarizing response from our fanbase every single time."
